sen.j: 国衙軍制（こくがぐんせい）とは、日本の古代末期から中世初頭にかけて（10世紀 - 12世紀）成立した国家軍事制度を指す歴史概念。
sen.e: The kokuga forces system indicates a historical concept of a national military system established in the era from around the end of the ancient times to the early medieval period of Japan (the 10th century - the twelfth century.

The kokuga forces system indicates a historical concept of a national military system established in the era from around the end of ancient times to the early medieval period of Japan (the 10th century - the 12th century).

sen.j: 律令国家が王朝国家へと変質し、朝廷から地方行政（国衙・受領）へ行政権を委任する過程で成立したとされる。
sen.e: It is said that this system was established in the process in which the ritsuryo-code based nation was changed to a dynastic nation and the imperial court entrusted its administrative rights to the local administrative organs (kokuga (provincial government offices) and zuryo (the head of the provincial governors)).

sen.j: また国衙軍制は、軍事貴族および武士の発生と密接に関係していると考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that the kokuga forces system was closely related to the birth of military nobles and samurai.

sen.j: 古代日本の律令国家は、軍事制度として軍団 (古代日本)を採用していた。
sen.e: The ritsuryo code-based nation in ancient Japan employed gundan (troops) (in ancient Japan) as the military system.

sen.j: 軍団兵士制は、古代の戸籍制度に登録された正丁（成年男子）3人に1人を徴発し、1国単位で約1000人規模の軍団を編成する制度である。
sen.e: In the gundan-soldier system, one out of every three adults registered in the family registration system was conscripted to organize a gundan of around 1000 persons in a province.

sen.j: これは7世紀後葉から8世紀前葉にかけての日本が、外国（唐・新羅）の脅威に対抗するため構築したものだった。
sen.e: This system was established for Japan in the era from the latter half of seventh century to the first half of the eighth century to cope with threat from foreign countries (Tang and Silla).

sen.j: しかし8世紀後葉、対新羅外交政策を転換したことに伴い、対外防衛・侵攻のための軍団兵士制も大幅に縮小されることとなった。
sen.e: However, the government changed its diplomatic policy against Silla in the latter half of the eight century, and therefore, the scale of the gundan-soldier system for defense and invasion was reduced drastically

sen.j: そのため、軍団兵士制を支えてきた戸籍制度を維持する必要性も低下していき、9世紀初頭以降、律令制の基盤となっていた戸籍を通じた個別人身支配が急速に形骸化していった。
sen.e: Therefore, the necessity of maintaining the family registration system having supported the gundan-soldier system diminished, and the control of individual persons through the family register, which constituted the base of the ritsuryo code-based nation, became a dead letter rapidly.

sen.j: 律令制の個別人身支配が弛緩していくと、在地社会の階層分化が進んだ。
sen.e: As the control of individual persons in the ritsuryo code-based system became weak, the hierarchical level of local societies advanced.

sen.j: 百姓の中から出挙・私営田活動を通じて富を蓄積した富豪層が成長し始めた。
sen.e: Some farmers accumulated wealth through suiko (government loans made to peasants) and operation of private land, constituting the rich and powerful class and growing.

sen.j: 地方行政にあたる国司は、郡司・富豪層に着目し、従来の個別人身支配の代わりに郡司・富豪層の在地経営を通じた支配へと転換していった。
sen.e: Kokushi (provincial governors) in charge of local administration focused attention on gunji (district managers) and the rich and powerful class, and changed its management of the province to control through local management by gunji (district managers) and persons in the rich and powerful class.

sen.j: 国司は調庸・封物を中央の朝廷へ運搬進納する義務を負っていた。
sen.e: Kokushi had the obligation of carrying and delivering choyo (tributes and labor) and fubutsu (products from fuko (the families supplied to each noble)) to the imperial court in the capital.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: しかしながら、国司はその運搬進納を担う綱領に郡司・富豪層を任じるようになった。
sen.e: However, Kokushi became to assign gunji or persons in the rich and powerful class to the head person responsible for the carriage and delivery.

sen.j: 調庸・封物の損失や未進が発生した場合は、郡司・富豪が私的に補償する義務を負わされた。
sen.e: When choyo and/or fubutsu was lost or could not be delivered, the gunji or the rich and powerful person was obliged to make necessary compensation privately.
When choyo and/or fubutsu was lost or could not be delivered, the gunji or the rich and powerful person was obliged to make necessary private compensation.

sen.j: 9世紀中葉ごろから、郡司・富豪層が運搬する進納物資を略奪する群盗海賊の横行が目立ち始めた。
sen.e: Starting around the middle of the ninth century, the robbers and pirates to plunder goods gunji or rich and powerful persons were conveying became to be rampant

sen.j: 群盗海賊の実態は、実は郡司・富豪層であった。
sen.e: Actually, these robbers and pirates were gunji or rich and powerful persons as well.

sen.j: 国司は実績をあげるため、郡司・富豪層へ過度な要求を課することが多くあった。
sen.e: To achieve respectable results, kokushi often made excessive requests to the gunji or rich and powerful persons.

sen.e: Therefore, the acts of the robbers or pirates were a style of protest for such requests, by gunji and rich and powerful persons.

sen.e: Therefore, the acts of the robbers or pirates were a style of protest against such requests, by gunji and rich and powerful persons.

sen.j: 略奪した物資は、補償すべき損失や未進に充てられたり、自らの富として蓄積されたりした。
sen.e: The plundered goods were used as substitutes for the lost goods or undelivered goods that they had to compensate, or were used for accumulating their wealth.
The plundered goods were used as substitutes for the lost goods or undelivered goods for which they had to compensate, or were used for accumulating their wealth.

sen.j: 群盗海賊の頻発に対し、朝廷と国司は、ほとんど形骸化した軍団兵士制では満足のいく対応ができなかったため、別の鎮圧方策をとる必要に迫られていた。
sen.e: Bobbers and pirates appeared frequently, but the imperial court and kokushi could not cope with the situation using the gundan-soldier system that had become a dead letter and were forced to take a new measure to combat them.

sen.j: 9世紀中葉における朝廷・国司は、群盗海賊の制圧のために養老律令の捕亡令追捕罪人条にある臨時発兵規定により対応し始めた。
sen.e: In the middle era of the ninth century, the imperial court and kokushi started taking measures based on specifications of "rinji-hatsuhei" (read the next sentence) in the article related to catching fled criminals (correctly, 捕亡令追捕罪人条 in Chinese characters) in the Yoro ritsuryo code, to combat these robberies and pirates.

In the middle of the ninth century, the imperial court and kokushi started taking measures based on specifications of "rinji-hatsuhei" (read the next sentence) in the article related to catching criminals who had fled (correctly, 捕亡令追捕罪人条 in Chinese characters) in the Yoro ritsuryo code, to combat these robberies and acts of piracy.

In the middle of the ninth century, the Imperial Court and kokushi started taking measures based on specifications of rinji-hatsuhei (the special dispatch of troops) in Tsuibu-zainin no Jo (the article related to catching criminals who had fled) in bumo-ryo code (Penalties on escaping soldiers, Sakimori [soldiers garrisoned at strategic posts in Kyushu in ancient times], slave, and so on) in the Yoro ritsuryo code, to combat these robberies and acts of piracy.

sen.j: 臨時発兵とは、群盗海賊の発生に際し、国司からの奏上に応じて「発兵勅符」を国司へ交付し、国司は勅符に基づき国内の兵を発して群盗海賊を制圧する方式を指す。
sen.e: Rinji-hatsuhei indicated the following system: When an act of robberies or pirates occurred, the imperial court issued "hatsuhei-chokufu" (an imperial order authorizing the mobilization of soldiers) corresponding to a request from a kokushi, and kokushi sent soldiers in the province to combat the robbers or pirates.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Rinji-hatsuhei indicated the following system: When an act of robbery or piracy occurred, the imperial court issued "hatsuhei-chokufu" (an imperial order authorizing the mobilization of soldiers) corresponding to a request from a kokushi, and the kokushi sent soldiers in the province to combat the robbers or pirates.

Rinji-hatsuhei indicated the following system: When an act of robbery or piracy occurred, the Imperial Court issued 'hatsuhei-chokufu' (an imperial order authorizing the mobilization of soldiers) corresponding to a request from a kokushi, and the kokushi sent soldiers in the province to combat the robbers or pirates.

sen.j: この方式は長らく適用されることはなかったが、群盗海賊の横行に直面してこの方式が採用されることとなった。
sen.e: This system had not been used for a long period, but became to be employed to cope with the rampant state of robbers and pirates.

sen.j: 臨時発兵規定で想定されていた兵とは、軍団 (古代日本)や健児ではなく、百姓のうち弓馬に通じた者であった。
sen.e: The soldiers supposed in the specifications of rinji-hatsuhei were not those belonging to gundan (in ancient Japan) nor strong adults, but farmers who were good at using bows and at riding a horse.

The soldiers supposed in the specifications of rinji-hatsuhei were neither those belonging to gundan (in ancient Japan) nor strong adults, but farmers who were skilled at using bows and at riding a horse.

sen.j: 弓馬に通じた百姓とはすなわち、郡司・富豪層であり、帰順して全国各地に移住させられた蝦夷の後裔たる俘囚であった。
sen.e: The farmers who were good at using bows and at riding a horse were gunji, rich powerful persons or fushu, descendants of the emishi (people resided in the northern areas in ancient times) who swore allegiance to the central government and were forced to move to various places throughout the country.

The farmers who were skilled at using bows and at riding a horse were gunji, rich and powerful persons, or fushu, descendants of the emishi (people who resided in the northern areas in ancient times) who swore allegiance to the central government and were forced to move to various places throughout the country.

sen.j: 臨時発兵規定の適用により、郡司・富豪層と俘囚が国内の軍事力として新たに編成されることとなったのである。
sen.e: This meant that, based on the application of the specifications of rinji-hatsuhei, gunji, rich and powerful persons and fushu were newly organized as military forces.

sen.j: 特に俘囚が有していた高い戦闘技術は、新たに形成されようとしている軍制に強い影響を与えた。
sen.e: In particular, the high-level fighting technique owned by fushu strongly affected the newly formed military system.
In particular, the high-level fighting technique posessed by fushu strongly affected the newly formed military system.

sen.j: 俘囚は騎馬戦術に優れており、騎乗で使用する白兵である蕨手刀は後の日本刀へとつながる毛抜形太刀の原型となっている。
sen.e: Fushu was superior in fighting riding on a horse, and the warabite-to (curved sword), an unsheathed sword used on a horse, became the original shape of Kenukigata-Tachi (hair-tweezers-shape Tachi (big sword)) that developed into Japanese swords.

Fushu were superior in fighting on horseback, and the warabite-to (curved sword), an unsheathed sword used on a horse, became the original shape of Kenukigata-Tachi (hair-tweezers-shaped Tachi (big sword)) that developed into Japanese swords.

sen.j: 883年（元慶7）に上総国で勃発した俘囚の武装蜂起（上総俘囚の乱）に際し、朝廷は発兵勅符ではなく、「追捕官符」を上総国司へ交付した。
sen.e: In the armed uprising that occurred in 883 in the Kazusa province, the imperial court issued "Tsuiho-kanpu" (warrants of pursuit and capture) instead of hatsuhei-chokufu.
In the armed uprising that occurred in 883 in Kazusa province, the Imperial Court issued "Tsuiho-kanpu" (warrants of pursuit and capture) instead of hatsuhei-chokufu.

In the armed fushu's uprising that occurred in 883 in Kazusa Province (Kazusa Fushu War), the Imperial Court issued 'Tsuibu kanpu' (warrants of pursuit and capture) to the kokushi of Kazusa Province, instead of hatsuhei-chokufu.

sen.j: 追捕官符とは、同じく捕亡令に基づくもので、逃亡した者を追捕することを命ずる太政官符である。
sen.e: Tsuiho-kanpu was a Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) that ordered the capture of fled criminals based on the same bumyo-ryo code.
Tsuiho-kanpu was a Daijokanpu (official document issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) that ordered the capture of criminals who had fled, based on the same bumyo-ryo code.
Tsuibu kanpu was a Daijokanpu (official document issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) that ordered the capture of criminals who had fled, based on the same bumo-ryo code.

sen.j: この事件を契機として、以後、追捕官符を根拠として、国司は追捕のため国内の人夫を動員する権限を獲得することとなり、積極的に群盗海賊の鎮圧に乗り出すようになった。
sen.e: After this incident, based on Tsuiho-kanpu, kokushi acquired the right to mobilize laborers to capture fled criminals, becoming to combat robbers and pirates actively.

After this incident, based on Tsuibu-kanpu, kokushi acquired the right to mobilize laborers to capture criminals who had fled, coming to combat robbers and pirates actively.

sen.j: そして、国司の中から、専任で群盗海賊の追捕にあたる者が登場した。
sen.e: Then, of the kokushi, persons specialized in capturing robberies and pirates appeared.
Then, among the kokushi, persons specialized in capturing robberies and pirates appeared.

sen.j: これは、後の追捕使・押領使・警固使の祖形であるとされている。
sen.e: It is said that these persons were the predecessors of Tsuibushi, Oryoshi, and Keigoshi.

sen.j: 以上のようにして、国衙軍制の原型が形成されていった。

sen.j: 9世紀末から10世紀初頭にかけての寛平・延喜期になると、抜本的な国政改革が展開した。
sen.e: In the Kanpyo to Engi eras (889 - 923), or in the era from around the end of ninth century to the early 10th century, the national administration was reformed drastically.
In the Kanpyo to Engi eras (889 - 923), or in the era from around the end of the ninth century to the early 10th century, the national administration was reformed drastically.
In the Kanpyo to Engi eras, that is to say, from around the end of the 9th century to the early 10th century, the national administration was reformed drastically.

sen.j: 調庸・封物を富豪層が京進することにより、院宮王臣家（皇族・有力貴族）は富豪層と結びつき、自らの収入たる封物の確保を図った。
sen.e: Because persons in the rich and powerful class carried choyo and fubutsu to Kyoto, Engu oshinke (imperial families and powerful nobles) became related to these rich and powerful persons to secure the fubutsu that were their income.

Because persons in the rich and powerful class carried choyo and fubutsu to Kyoto, Engu oshinke (imperial families and powerful nobles) became related to these rich and powerful persons to secure the fubutsu that constituted their income.

Because persons in the rich and powerful class paid carried choyo (national tax) and fubutsu (collected goods as tax) to Kyoto, Ingu oshinke (imperial families and powerful nobles) became related to these rich and powerful persons to secure the fubutsu that constituted their income.
sen.cmt: 用語補足、読み修正しました。

sen.j: 富豪層も自らの私営田を院宮王臣家へ寄進して荘園とし、国衙への納税回避を図っていった。
sen.e: Persons in the rich and powerful class contributed their private land to Engu oshinke as manors to avoid tax obligation to kokuga (provincial government offices).

Persons in the rich and powerful class contributed their private land to Ingu oshinke as manors to avoid tax obligation to kokuga.
sen.cmt: 前出読みに合わせ、前出補足を削除しました。

sen.j: かかる危機に直面した国衙行政と中央財政を再建させるために、院宮王臣家と富豪層の関係を断ち切るとともに、国司へ大幅な支配権限を委譲する改革が行われたのである。
sen.e: In the reformation to reestablish the kokuga administration and the finance of the central government, the relationships between Engu oshinke and rich and powerful persons broken and much of the control right was transferred to kokushi.

sen.j: これにより成立した支配体制を王朝国家という。

sen.j: 11世紀中葉に、王朝国家体制の変革が行われた。
sen.e: In the middle era of the eleventh century, the dynastic national system was reformed.
In the middle era of the eleventh century, the dynastic national system was reformed.
In the middle era of the 11th century, the dynastic national system was reformed.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字にしました。

sen.j: 1040年代を画期として、それ以前を前期王朝国家、以降を後期王朝国家と区分する考えがある。
sen.e: There is a concept of separating the dynastic nation system after 1040 from that before 1040, with the earlier one called the first dynastic nation system and the later one the latter dynastic nation system.

There is a concept of separating the dynastic nation system after 1040 from that before 1040, with the earlier one called the first dynastic nation system and the later one the latter dynastic nation system.

There is a concept of separating the dynastic nation system after 1040s from that before 1040, with the earlier one called the early dynastic nation system and the later one the late dynastic nation system.

sen.j: この考えによると、後期王朝国家は全国的な租税賦課（一国平均役など）を契機として成立した。
sen.e: Based on this concept, it can be said that the latter dynastic nation system was established corresponding to the start of national taxation (for example, Ikkoku heikinyaku (taxes and labor uniformly imposed on shoen (manor) and kokugaryoi (provincial land) in a province).

Based on this concept, it can be said that the latter dynastic nation system was established corresponding to the start of national taxation (for example, Ikkoku heikinyaku (taxes and labor uniformly imposed on shoen (manors) and kokugaryoi (provincial land) in a province).

Based on this concept, it can be said that the late dynastic nation system was established corresponding to the start of national taxation (for example, Ikkoku heikinyaku [taxes and labor uniformly imposed on shoen [manor] and kokugaryo [provincial land] in a province).

sen.j: それまでは、受領の権限のもとで地方行政が展開しており、郡司・富豪層らが開発してきた荘園も国衙の承認によって存立していた（国免荘）。
sen.e: Until then, local administration functioned under zuryo's authority, and the manors that had been developed by gunji or rich and powerful persons could exist by obtaining approval from the kokuga (kokumensho (the manor whose obligations were exempted by kokushi)).

Until then, local administration functioned under zuryo's authority, and the manors that had been developed by gunji or rich and powerful persons could exist by obtaining approval from the kokuga (kokumensho (the manor whose obligations were exempted by kokushi)).

sen.j: しかし、内裏の焼亡などを契機とした臨時措置として全国的な租税賦課が実施されると、荘園側は、国衙でなく中央の太政官へ免税の申請を行うようになった。
sen.e: However, when, starting with the burning-down of dairi (Imperial Palace), the central government levied national taxes as a temporary measures, the manor side became to apply for tax exemption to Daijokan in the central government, instead of kokuga.

However, when, starting with the burning-down of dairi (Imperial Palace), the central government levied national taxes as a temporary measure, the manor side came to apply for tax exemption to Daijokan in the central government, instead of kokuga.

sen.j: 免税特権を獲得した荘園は領域が統合される一円化の措置などを通じて拡大する傾向を示し、国衙が支配する国衙領を蚕食し始めた。
sen.e: The manors that acquired tax exemption privilege started enlarging their territories through the unification of their territory control, encroaching on the kokuga territories controlled by kokuga.

sen.j: ここに至り、田堵負名層らによる対受領闘争（「凶党」行為）はほとんど見られなくなり、代わって荘園と公領間の相論・武力紛争が頻発し始めた。
sen.e: Then the conflicts in which persons of the Tato fumyo class fought against zuryo ("gangsters"-like acts) almost ceased, and instead, disputes and armed conflicts between manors and Koryo (an Imperial demesne) began occurring frequently.

sen.j: 国衙軍制は凶党の追捕を対象としていた。
sen.e: The purpose of the kokuga forces system was to capture gangsters.

sen.e: However, in disputes between manors and koryo, it was decided that the manor side did not constitute gangsters.

sen.e: Therefore, the kokuga forces system could not be used for suppressing conflicts between manors and koryo.

sen.j: そこで受領は荘園への対抗手段として、主に軍事的に対応能力を有する武士身分の田堵負名に公領の経営と治安維持を委任することで、公領の維持を図ったのである。
sen.e: Consequently, as a measure against manors, zuryo entrusted the management of koryo and security duty mostly to the Tato fumyo with the samurai status who had military abilities, to maintain koryo.
Consequently, as a measure against manors, zuryo entrusted the management of koryo and security duty mostly to the Tato fumyo with the samurai status who had military abilities, to maintain koryo.

sen.j: その際、国内の武士身分の田堵負名のうち、同一の郡に基盤を持つ者同士が互いに競合しあった。
sen.e: In taking such a measure, of the Tato fumyo with the samurai status in a province, those in the same gun (county) competed with each others.

sen.j: そのため、従来郡の下にあった郷などの領域を郡と同等の国衙統治下の単位に引き上げる措置がとられた。
sen.e: Therefore, kokuga took the measure of raising the status of the areas formerly placed under gun, for examples, villages, to a status equal to that of gun.

sen.j: その結果、競合する武士が対等な地位を得られるように、それぞれの経営責任者に任ぜられたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that, resultantly, each of the competed samurai became to be provided with the same social status and to be appointed to the manager of a koryo.

sen.j: こうして公領は郡・郷・保などの単位に再編成され、武士たちは郡司・郷司・保司として郡・郷・保の経営と治安維持を受け持つこととなった。
sen.e: In this way, koryo was reorganized into gun (county), go (village) and ho (community), and samurai became to be in charge of the management and security maintenance of gun, go or ho as gunji (an official in charge of a gun), goji (an official in charge of a village) or a hoji (an official in charge of a community).

sen.j: 彼ら武士は、受領から委任された徴税権・検断権・勧農権などを根拠として、在地領主へと成長していった。
sen.e: Based on the tax collection right, the right to judge criminal cases and the right to promote farming all of which were entrusted by zuryo, these samurai grew into local lords.

sen.j: さらに言えば、武士身分の田堵負名は、自らの私営田を権門勢家（皇室・有力貴族・有力寺社）へ寄進して荘園とするとともに、荘官に任じられてもいた。
sen.e: In addition, some Tato fumyo with the samurai status donated their privately operated fields to the great and powerful (Imperial families, powerful nobles, or powerful temples or shrines), making them manors and being appointed to shokan (the officers governing these manors).

sen.j: つまり、彼らは一方では国衙側の郡司・郷司として国衙領の維持にあたり、一方では荘園側の荘官として荘園拡大を図っていたのである。
sen.e: In other words, while acting to maintain kokuga territories as gunji or goji on the Kokuga side, they also attempted to enlarge manors as shokan on the manor side.

sen.j: こうして武士の在地領主化が進行していった。
sen.e: In this way, more and more samurai became local lords.

sen.j: 在地領主化した武士は、在庁官人となって国衙行政に参画する一方で、婚姻関係を通じて党を組み、武士団と呼ばれる結合関係を構築していった。
sen.e: The samurai who became local lords participated in kokuga administration as officers in the kokuga office, and on the other hand, also established a relationship called a samurai group, through marital relations.

The samurai who became local lords participated in kokuga administration as officers in the kokuga office, and at the same time, also established a relationship called a samurai group, through marital relations.

sen.j: 一国に1人置かれる国追捕使または国押領使は、次第に特定の家系が世襲するようになった。
sen.e: The position of the koku (province)-tsuibushi or koku-oryoshi assigned to each province gradually became hereditary, being monopolized by a specific family line.

sen.j: こうした累代の国追捕使は国内武士の指導者、つまり「一国棟梁」として国内武士を組織化した。
sen.e: Such successive koku-tsuibushi in a province organized samurai in the province as the leader of the samurai in the province, or as "the provincial leader."

sen.e: Such successive koku-tsuibushi in a province organized samurai in the province as the leader of the samurai in the province, or as "the provincial leader."
Such successive koku-tsuibushi in a province organized samurai in the province as the leader of the samurai in the province, or as 'Ikkoku-toryo' (the provincial leader).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションにしました。

sen.j: 11世紀中葉の後期王朝国家の成立以来、国衙軍制は機能停止してしまった。
sen.e: After the latter dynastic nation was established in the middle era of the eleventh century, the kokuga forces system stopped functioning.
After the latter dynastic nation was established in the middle of the eleventh century, the kokuga forces system stopped functioning.
After the latter dynastic nation was established in the middle of the 11th century, the kokuga forces system stopped functioning.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字にしました。

sen.j: 国内武士は受領の動員命令ではなく、追捕使の地位を持つ「一国棟梁」の指揮に従うようになっていた。
sen.e: Samurai in a province became to follow the leadership of "the provincial leader" provided with the position of Tsuibushi, instead of the mobilization order by zuryo.
Samurai in a province came to follow the leadership of "the provincial leader" provided with the position of Tsuibushi, instead of the mobilization order by zuryo.
Samurai in a province came to follow the leadership of 'Ikkoku toryo' provided with the position of Tsuibushi, instead of the mobilization order by zuryo.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションにしました。

sen.j: 1030年（長元3）の平忠常の乱に際して追討使に任じられた源頼信がすぐに忠常を帰服させた。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorinobu who was appointed to tsuitoshi (the person in charge of searching for and capturing criminals) in Revolt of TAIRA no Tadatsune in 1030 made Tadatsune surrender immediately.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, who was appointed tsuitoshi (the person in charge of searching for and capturing criminals) in the Revolt of TAIRA no Tadatsune in 1030, made Tadatsune surrender immediately.
MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, who was appointed tsuitoshi (the person in charge of searching for and capturing criminals) in the TAIRA no Tadatsune War in 1030, made Tadatsune surrender immediately.
sen.cmt: 指示書に合わせました。

sen.j: その後は、朝廷は国衙軍制に代わる軍事制度として追討使方式を多用し始めた。
sen.e: After that, the imperial court started the tsuitoshi-using system frequently as the military system replacing the kokuga forces system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, the imperial court frequently started employing the tsuitoshi-using system as the military system replacing the kokuga forces system.
After that, the Imperial Court frequently started employing the tsuitoshi-using system as the military system replacing the kokuga forces system.

sen.j: 軍事貴族である源頼信は、追討の成功により多くの板東武士と主従関係を結び、最初の「武家の棟梁」と呼びうる存在となった。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, a military noble, established master-servant relationships with many Bando Bushi (samurai in the eastern region) through the success of the searching and capturing activities, becoming the first person who could be called "the leader of samurai families."
sen.cmt: 板東： 正しい表記は「坂東武士」だと思われますが表記はそのままにしています。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, a military noble, established master-servant relationships with many Bando Bushi (samurai in the eastern region) through the success of the searching and capturing activities, becoming the first person who could be called "the leader of samurai families."

MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, a military noble, established master-servant relationships with many Bando Bushi (samurai in the eastern region) through the success of the searching and capturing activities, becoming the first person who could be called 'Buke no toryo' (the leader of samurai families).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションなどにしました。

sen.j: 有事の際にはこうした「武家の棟梁」が追討使に補任され、主従関係を結んでいる「一国棟梁」以下の武士を動員し、軍事活動を展開したのである。
sen.e: In an emergency, such "leader of samurai families" was appointed to tsuitoshi, and the leader mobilized samurai under "the provincial leader" with whom he had a master-servant relationship, to carry out necessary military activities.

In an emergency, such a "leader of samurai families" was appointed tsuitoshi, and the leader mobilized samurai under "the provincial leader" with whom he had a master-servant relationship, to carry out necessary military activities.

In an emergency, such a 'Buke no toryo' was appointed tsuitoshi, and the leader mobilized samurai under 'Ikkoku toryo' with whom he had a master-servant relationship, to carry out necessary military activities.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションにしました。

sen.j: 12世紀末の治承・寿永の内乱（源平合戦）を経て、初期鎌倉幕府政権は、国追捕使の権限を継承した惣追捕使を各国に設置することについて、朝廷から承認を得た。
sen.e: After Jisho-Juei Civil War (the Genpei War) towards the end of the twelfth century, the Kamakura government at its initial stage got approval from the imperial court of placing Sotsuibushi (government post in charge of police and military roles), inheriting the rights of koku-tsuibushi, in each province.

After the Jisho-Juei Civil War (the Genpei War) towards the end of the twelfth century, the Kamakura government at its initial stage gained the approval of the imperial court to establish Sotsuibushi (government post in charge of police and military roles), inheriting the rights of koku-tsuibushi, in each province.

After the Jisho-Juei Civil War (the Genpei War) towards the end of the 12th century, the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) at its initial stage gained the approval of the Imperial Court to establish Sotsuibushi (government post in charge of police and military roles), inheriting the rights of koku-tsuibushi, in each province.

sen.j: 惣追捕使は、国内武士を統率する役割を担っており、これは国衙軍制の枠組みを導入したものと評価できる。
sen.e: Sotsuibushi had the role of controlling samurai in the province, and it can be evaluated that this system introduced the framework of the kokuga force system.
Sotsuibushi had the role of controlling samurai in the province, and this system can be evaluated as introducing the framework of the kokuga force system.
Sotsuibushi had the role of controlling samurai in the province, and this system can be evaluated as introducing the framework of the kokuga force system.

sen.j: 惣追捕使はその後、守護制度へと発展していった。
sen.e: After this, the system of using Sotsuibushi developed into the Shugo (provincial constable) system
After this, the system of using Sotsuibushi developed into the Shugo (provincial constable) system
After this, the system of using Sotsuibushi developed into the Shugo (provincial constable) system.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: かつて、古代的な貴族統治体制を打破したのは武装農民層に由来する武士であるとする説が有力とされていた。
sen.e: In the past, it was said to be most plausible that samurai originated in the armed farmers defeated the ancient aristocratic control system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the past, it was said to be most plausible that samurai originated in the armed farmers who defeated the ancient aristocratic control system.
In the past, it was said to be most plausible that samurai originated in the armed farmers who defeated the ancient aristocratic control system.

sen.j: しかしながら、1960年代に戸田芳実や石井進 (歴史学者)らによる国衙機構に関する研究が進展すると、武士の起源武装農民説はもはや成立し得なくなった。
sen.e: However, as research about the kokuga system was advanced by Yoshimi TODA and Susumu ISHII (each of them a historian) in 1960s, it became impossible to consider that samurai originated in armed farmers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, as research about the kokuga system was advanced by Yoshimi TODA and Susumu ISHII (each of them a historian) in the 1960s, it became impossible to consider that samurai originated in armed farmers.

However, as research about the kokuga system was advanced by Yoshimi TODA and Susumu ISHII (each of them a historian) in the 1960s, it became impossible to consider that samurai originated in armed farmers.

sen.j: 国衙軍制の可能性を指摘し、それが武士の起源に関係することを論じたものには、石井進『中世成立期軍制研究の一視点』（「史学雑誌」78編12号所載、1969年）や戸田芳実『国衙軍制の形成過程』（「中世の権力と民衆」所載、創元社、1970年）などがある。
sen.e: The papers where the possibility of the kokuga forces system was pointed out and the relation of the system to the origin of samurai was discussed include "A viewpoint concerning research about the military system in the early medieval period" by Susumu ISHII (Shigaku zasshi (Journal of Historical Studies), No. 12, vol. 78, in 1969) and "The process in which the kokuga forces system was formed" by Yoshimi TODA (recorded in "Power and the general public in the medieval period," published by Sodensha, in 1970).

The papers that pointed out the possibility of the kokuga forces system and discussed the relation of the system to the origin of samurai include "A viewpoint concerning research about the military system in the early medieval period" by Susumu ISHII (Shigaku zasshi (Journal of Historical Studies), No. 12, vol. 78, in 1969) and "The process in which the kokuga forces system was formed" by Yoshimi TODA (recorded in "Power and the general public in the medieval period," published by Sodensha, in 1970).

The papers that pointed out the possibility of the kokuga forces system and discussed the relation of the system to the origin of samurai include "A viewpoint concerning research about the military system in the early medieval period" written by Susumu ISHII ('Shigaku zasshi' (Journal of Historical Studies), No. 12, vol. 78, in 1969) and "The process in which the kokuga forces system was formed" written by Yoshimi TODA (recorded in 'Power and the general public in the medieval period,' published by Sogensha, in 1970).
sen.cmt: スペル修正などしました。

sen.j: その後、武士の起源に関する研究は、職能論などが議論の中心となり、国衙軍制論は半ば忘れられた状態となった。
sen.e: After that, the research about origin of samurai was conducted centered on job function-based theories, and theories based on the kokuga forces system remained almost forgotten.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, research about the origin of samurai was conducted centered on job-function-based theories, and theories based on the kokuga forces system were almost forgotten.
After that, research about the origin of samurai was conducted centered on job-function-based theories, and theories based on the kokuga forces system were almost forgotten.

sen.j: しかしながら、1970年代末から1980年代にかけて下向井龍彦らによる研究・問題提起が積極的に進められた。
sen.e: However, in the period from around the end of 1970s to early 1980, Tatsuhiko SHIMOMUKAI and others promoted research and raised various issues actively from the latter viewpoint.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the period from around the end of the 1970s to early 1980, Tatsuhiko SHIMOMUKAI and others actively promoted research and raised various issues from the latter viewpoint.
However, in the period from around the end of the 1970s to 1980s, Tatsuhiko SHIMOMUKAI and others actively promoted research and raised various issues from the latter viewpoint.

sen.j: 下向井らの議論は、武士の成立を王朝国家論・荘園公領制論などと整合的・有機的に結びつけるものであり、21世紀初頭において、武士成立に関する最も有力な説の一つに位置づけられている。
sen.e: The theory by SHIMOMUKAI and others connects the establishment of samurai to the dynastic nation theory and the shoen koryo sei (The System of Public Lands and Private Estates) theory consistently and systematically, and in the early 21st century, has been positioned as one of the most promising theories concerning the establishment of samurai.

The theory by SHIMOMUKAI and others connects the establishment of samurai to the dynastic nation theory and the shoen koryo sei (The System of Public Lands and Private Estates) theory consistently and systematically, and in the early 21st century, has been positioned as one of the most promising theories concerning the establishment of samurai.

The theory by Shimomukai and others connects the establishment of samurai to the dynastic nation theory and the shoen koryo sei (The System of Public Lands and Private Estates) theory consistently and systematically, and in the early 21st century, has been positioned as one of the most promising theories concerning the establishment of samurai.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字にしました。
